name: SPIDER PLANT
text: In the right conditions, Spider Plants can asexually reproduce by developing long stems which produce small clones called 'spiderettes'.

name: MONSTERA
text: Holey leaves allow Monsteras to grow and cover a larger area while needing to use less resources to do so, it also stops the upper leaves from blocking the sun.

name: SNAKE PLANT
text: Instead of releasing oxygen in the day while the plant photosynthesises, Snake Plants only release oxygen at night to avoid dehydration.

name: ANGEL'S WING CACTUS
text: This plant is commonly know as the prickly pear as it produces sweet edible fruit that are eaten raw, and are used in traditional mexican cuisine.

name: GOLDEN POTHOS
text: The Golden Pothos is a native of Australia, Indonesia, China, Japan and India. Every part of this plant is poisonous to humans and animals.

name: CHINESE MONEY PLANT
text: Brought to Europe from China by a Swedish missionary in 1946, this plant was discovered growing on the CanShang mountains in Yunna province.

name: RUBBER PLANT
text: Yes, rubber comes from the Rubber Plant! The Ficus elastica is a well-known household plant that produces latex, which is used to produce rubber.

name: JADE PLANT
text: The Chinese Money Plant has long been used in chinese medicine as extracts from this plant are used to treat wounds, stomach upsets and warts.

name: AFRICAN MILK TREE
text: Often mistaken for a cactus, the African Milk tree is a succulent native to central Africa that gets its name from the milky white sap it produces.

name: STRING OF PEARLS
text: A narrow translucent band of tissue on each pearl allows light to enter and irradate the interior of the leaf, this increases photosynthetic productivity.

name: ARECA PALM
text: The Areca is often referred to as a cane type palm because it's long stems are closely resemble that of a bamboo plant, causing the two to often get confused.

name: CALATHEA
text: If watered frequently enough, some varieties of Calathea open and close their leaves during the day and night cycle in response to the changing light levels.
